reactor.core.publisher

Interface MonoSink<T>

  • Type Parameters:
    T - the value type emitted

    public interface MonoSink<T>
    Wrapper API around an actual downstream Subscriber for emitting nothing, a single value or an error (mutually exclusive).

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Context currentContext()
      Return the current subscriber Context.
      void error(Throwable e)
      Terminate with the give exception
      MonoSink<T> onCancel(Disposable d)
      Associates a disposable resource with this MonoSink that will be disposed on downstream.cancel().
      MonoSink<T> onDispose(Disposable d)
      Associates a disposable resource with this MonoSink that will be disposed on the first terminate signal which may be a cancel, complete or error signal.
      MonoSink<T> onRequest(LongConsumer consumer)
      Attaches a LongConsumer to this MonoSink that will be notified of any request to this sink.
      void success()
      Complete without any value.
      void success(T value)
      Complete with the given value.

    • Method Detail

      • currentContext

        Context currentContext()
        Return the current subscriber Context.

        Context can be enriched via Mono.subscriberContext(Function) operator or directly by a child subscriber overriding CoreSubscriber.currentContext()

        Returns:
        the current subscriber Context.

      • success

        void success()
        Complete without any value.

        Calling this method multiple times or after the other terminating methods has no effect.

      • success

        void success(@Nullable
             T value)
        Complete with the given value.

        Calling this method multiple times or after the other terminating methods has no effect (the value is purely ignored). Calling this method with a null value will be silently accepted as a call to success() by standard implementations.

        Parameters:
        value - the value to complete with

      • error

        void error(Throwable e)
        Terminate with the give exception

        Calling this method multiple times or after the other terminating methods is an unsupported operation. It will discard the exception through the Hooks.onErrorDropped(Consumer) hook (which by default throws the exception wrapped via Exceptions.bubble(Throwable)). This is to avoid complete and silent swallowing of the exception.

        Parameters:
        e - the exception to complete with

      • onRequest

        MonoSink<T> onRequest(LongConsumer consumer)
        Attaches a LongConsumer to this MonoSink that will be notified of any request to this sink.
        Parameters:
        consumer - the consumer to invoke on each request
        Returns:
        MonoSink with a consumer that is notified of requests

      • onCancel

        MonoSink<T> onCancel(Disposable d)
        Associates a disposable resource with this MonoSink that will be disposed on downstream.cancel().
        Parameters:
        d - the disposable callback to use
        Returns:
        the MonoSink with resource to be disposed on cancel signal

      • onDispose

        MonoSink<T> onDispose(Disposable d)
        Associates a disposable resource with this MonoSink that will be disposed on the first terminate signal which may be a cancel, complete or error signal.
        Parameters:
        d - the disposable callback to use
        Returns:
        the MonoSink with resource to be disposed on first terminate signal
